body.p:
Catlettsburg Ky
April 19th 1865,
To his Excellency
Thomas E,, Bramlett
Governer of Ky.

Your Petitioner John Mann says at the present term of this (the Boyd circuit court) he was tried in an indictment for an assault and Batery upen a man by the name of Thomas, He further says he proved upon the trial by two Witnesses that when he struck Thomas sd Thomas was advancing upon him in a violent and thretening manner with an open knife, that your Petitioner told him to stop and not advance on him, but still he continued to advance your Pitetioner gave back as often as twice when in his one and necessary defense he did strike Thomas with a bottle not useing more force than was necessary; for his own defense -- he says the Jury in this evidence fined your affiant $40,,00 and cost, he says the above fact are true that he is a poor man and a day labourer for his suport he prays your excellency to remit said fine
Sworn to before me by John Mann this 19th April 1865
G. R. Burgess J. P. B. C.

We the undersigned have examined the foregoing Petition and heard the proof in the cause therin referred to and know the same is n correctly stated and hope your Excellency will remit said fine as we think it a hardship for Mr Mann to have the fine to pay

Owen Hall
Ira Gillem
D. D. Sublett
John Eastham
W. O. Hampton clk
John M. Burns
Geo E Roe
J W. Mead
Samuel Claire
John H McKee
James M Rice
M. C. W. Soward

Boyd Cir Ct
vs
